alert.note: Alert for Lassen; Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 8:26PM PDT until June 12 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN LASSEN AND NORTHWESTERN PLUMAS COUNTIES... At 826 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produced heavy rain over the Dixie Fire West Burn Scar have moved away from the area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell from 12 pm to 6 pm over portions of Plumas county. Water will continue draining down creeks and canyons, which could cause debris flows. Excessive rainfall over the warning area has caused mud and rock slides along highway 70 through the feather river canyon. This has caused several road closures. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Flash flooding in and around the Dixie Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Dixie Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chester, Almanor, Prattville, Lake Almanor West, Lake Almanor Country Club, Canyondam, East Shore, Caribou, Seneca, Belden, Twain, Paxton, Indian Falls, Bald Eagle Mountain, Tobin, Crescent Mills, Storrie, Keddie and Greenville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Dixie Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
